newsitem.title: UK: Rank buys British pub operator Tom Cobleigh.
newsitem.headline: Rank buys British pub operator Tom Cobleigh.

text.p: The Rank Organisation Plc branched out into pub ownership Tuesday with an agreement to acquire the Tom Cobleigh chain, paying about 95.6 million pounds ($149 million).
Rank said directors of Tom Cobleigh had agreed to sell shares representing 61.5 percent of the company.

The diversified entertainments and leisure group said it intended both to develop Tom Cobleigh as a stand-alone business and to integrate some new Tom Cobleigh pubs into existing and future locations.

Tom Cobleigh had said Sept. 13 that it was in talks that might lead to an offer. Rank had been reported as a likely buyer of Tom Cobleigh. Its bid exceeded an earlier offer from Yates Brothers Wine Lodges.
Rank said the deal was expected to have no impact on earnings in the first full year after the deal closes and should enhance earnings after that.
